results.name: Number of prime factors of 2^n + 1 (counted with multiplicity).
comment: The length of row n in A001269.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1062 (terms 0..500 from T. D. Noe)
S. S. Wagstaff, Jr., The Cunningham Project
mathematica: a[q_] := Module[{x, n}, x=FactorInteger[2^n+1]; n=Length[x]; Sum[Table[x[i]][2]], {i, n}][j]], {j, n}]]
A054992[n_Integer] := PrimeOmega[2^n + 1]; Table[A054992[n], {n,200}] (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Jul 22 2011 *)
xref: Cf. A046051 (number of prime factors of 2^n-1).
Cf. A086257 (number of primitive prime factors).
results.author: Arne Ring (arne.ring(AT)epost.de), May 30 2000
ext: Deleted duplicate (and broken) Wagstaff link. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 18 2019
